p:
To further understand the de-excitation and Dy 3+ → Sm 3+ energy transform processes, decay curves of CLSO:Dy 3+, CLSO:Sm 3+ and co-doped CLSO:Dy 3+/Sm 3+ phosphors are measured for 4F 9/2 level of Dy 3+ ions and 4G 5/2 level of Sm 3+ ions, and shown on Fig. 5(D). Red lines all are fitting lines and fitting index R 2 value also are shown on Fig. 5(D). All samples are excited at 365 nm wavelength with different monitored wavelength, and it can be found that all of decay curves can be successfully fitted with a typical second order exponential decay equation
32 as follows:
7

where I(t) represents at time t the luminescence intensity and I 0 is the initial luminescence intensity, A 1 and A 2 are decay constants, τ 1 and τ 2 respectively stand slow and rapid lifetimes for exponential components. Besides, the effective time (τ *) can be calculated as following equation:
